org.overture.parser.lex

Class LexTokenReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • org.overture.parser.lex.BacktrackInputReader
        • org.overture.parser.lex.LexTokenReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Readable

    public class LexTokenReader
extends BacktrackInputReader
    The main lexical analyser class.

      • LexTokenReader

        public LexTokenReader(File file,
                      Dialect dialect)
        Create a LexTokenReader for the filename passed.
        Parameters:
        file - The filename to parse.
        dialect - if VDM-SL or VDM++ tokens should be processed.

      • LexTokenReader

        public LexTokenReader(File file,
                      Dialect dialect,
                      String charset)
        Create a LexTokenReader for the filename and charset passed.
        Parameters:
        file - The filename to parse.
        dialect - if VDM-SL or VDM++ tokens should be processed.
        charset - The charset for the file.

      • LexTokenReader

        public LexTokenReader(String expression,
                      Dialect dialect)
        Create a LexTokenReader for the string passed.
        Parameters:
        expression - The string (expression) to parse.
        dialect - Parse VDM++ or VDM-SL tokens.

      • LexTokenReader

        public LexTokenReader(String expression,
                      Dialect dialect,
                      String charset)
        Create a LexTokenReader for the string and charset passed.
        Parameters:
        expression - The string (expression) to parse.
        dialect - Parse VDM++ or VDM-SL tokens.
        charset - The charset to use.

      • LexTokenReader

        public LexTokenReader(String content,
                      Dialect dialect,
                      File file)
        Create a LexTokenReader to read content which originates from a file which is not yet saved and enable the source of the file to be set. This is used in the IDE to provide while typing outline and parse error info.
        Parameters:
        content -
        dialect -
        file -

      • LexTokenReader

                      File file,

        file -

      • toString

        public String toString()
        A string representation of the current location.

      • push

        public void push()
        Description copied from class: BacktrackInputReader
        Push the current location to permit backtracking.
        Overrides:
        push in class BacktrackInputReader
        See Also:
        BacktrackInputReader.push()

      • pop

        public void pop()
        Description copied from class: BacktrackInputReader
        Pop the last location and reposition the stream at that position. The state of the stream is such that the next read operation will return the same character that would have been read immediately after the push() operation that saved the position.
        Overrides:
        pop in class BacktrackInputReader
        See Also:
        BacktrackInputReader.pop()

      • unpush

        public void unpush()
        Description copied from class: BacktrackInputReader
        Pop the last location, but do not backtrack to it. This is used when the parser reached a point where a potential ambiguity has been resolved, and it knows that it will never need to backtrack.
        Overrides:
        unpush in class BacktrackInputReader
        See Also:
        BacktrackInputReader.unpush()

      • retry

        public void retry()
        Go back to the mark, and re-mark it. This just calls pop() followed by push().

      • getCharsRead

        public int getCharsRead()
        Returns:
        the number of characters read since the last push().

      • getTokensRead

        public int getTokensRead()
        Returns:
        the number of tokens read since the last push().

      • nextToken

        public LexToken nextToken()
                   throws LexException
        Read the next complete token from the input stream. Whitespace is skipped, and the start line and position of the token are noted from the current stream position. Then the next character to process is used to drive a large switch statement to produce the right VDMToken. The lastToken field is updated and the result returned.
        Returns:
        The next token, or a LexToken of type EOF.
        Throws:
        LexException

      • getLast

        public LexToken getLast()
                 throws LexException
        Get the last token returned from the reader.
        Returns:
        The last token, or the first token if none read yet.
        Throws:
        LexException
